sen.j: 朧月夜（おぼろづくよ、おぼろづきよ）は紫式部の物語『源氏物語』の架空の登場人物。
sen.e: Oborozukiyo (also called Oborozukuyo) is a fictional character in "The Tale of Genji" written by Murasaki Shikibu.
Oborozukiyo (also called Oborozukuyo) is a fictional character in "The Tale of Genji" written by Murasaki Shikibu.

sen.j: 六の君、有明の君、尚侍君（かんのきみ）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: She is also called Roku no Kimi, Ariake no Kimi and Kan no Kimi.

sen.j: この名は大江千里 (歌人)の和歌「照りもせず曇りもはてぬ春の夜の朧月夜にしく（似る）ものぞなき」に由来する。
sen.e: This name comes from a waka poem composed by OE no Chisato, 'There is nothing like a night in spring with a hazy moon, neither shining brightly nor clouded'.
sen.cmt: 原文「(歌人)（歌人）」とありますが、文脈からわかるのと重複しているため、削除しました。

This name (Oborozukiyo or the misty moon) comes from a waka poem composed by OE no Chisato, 'There is nothing like a night in spring with a hazy moon, neither shining brightly nor clouded'.
sen.cmt: ウェブでは（歌人）となっているので、重複部分は原文から削除しました。「朧月夜」の意味を補足しました。

sen.j: 当時権勢を誇った桐壺帝の右大臣の六の君（六番目の娘）で、弘徽殿女御の妹という高貴な生まれ。
sen.e: She was born as Roku no Kimi (the sixth daughter) of the Udaijin (Minister of the Right), who had been in power during the reign of Emperor Kiritsubo, and Lady Kokiden's younger sister.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: She was born as Roku no Kimi (the sixth daughter) of the Udaijin (Minister of the Right), who had been in power during the reign of Emperor Kiritsubo, and was also Lady Kokiden's younger sister.

She was nobly born as Roku no Kimi (the sixth daughter) of the Udaijin (Minister of the Right), who had been in power during the reign of Emperor Kiritsubo, and was also Lady Kokiden's younger sister.
sen.cmt: 「高貴な」 訳漏れ対応しました。

sen.j: だが、作中では珍しい艶やかで奔放な気性の女君である。
sen.e: However, she is a beguiling and uninhibited lady, of a kind that rarely appears in the story.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 姉弘徽殿女御の産んだ朱雀帝の女御に入内する予定だった。
sen.e: She was to have entered the Imperial court as the bride of Emperor Suzaku, who was born to her older sister Lady Kokiden.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処（三文に分割）
sen.e: It was intended that she would enter the Imperial court as the bride of Emperor Suzaku, who was born to her older sister Lady Kokiden.

sen.j: が、宮中の桜花の宴の夜に思いがけなくも光源氏と出会う。
sen.e: However, she unexpectedly met Hikaru Genji on the night of a festival of cherry blossoms in the Imperial court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処（三文に分割）

sen.j: 後に関係が発覚して入内は取り止めになる。
sen.e: Later, their relationship was revealed and her bridal entry into court was called off.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処（三文に分割）
sen.e: Later, their relationship was exposed and her bridal entry into court was called off.

sen.j: 葵の上の死後、右大臣は源氏と結婚させることも考えたが、弘徽殿女御が猛反対した。
sen.e: After the death of Lady Aoi, the Udaijin thought about marrying her to Genji, but Lady Kokiden was vigorously against it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the death of Lady Aoi, the Udaijin considered marrying her to Genji, but Lady Kokiden was vehemently against it.
After the death of Lady Aoi, the Udaijin considered marrying her to Genji, but Lady Kokiden was vehemently against it.

sen.j: 源氏自身も既に紫の上を妻にしていたため実現しなかった。
sen.e: Besides, Genji himself had already married Lady Murasaki, and it never happened.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Regardless, as Genji himself had already married Lady Murasaki, it never happened.

sen.j: 始め貞観殿の別当として登華殿にあり、後に尚侍（ないしのかみ）となって弘徽殿に移る。
sen.e: At first she lived in the Tokaden pavilion as the chief of the Joganden pavilion, then became the chief of Naishi no Tsukasa (the Handmaids' office) and moved to the Kokiden pavilion.
sen.cmt: 原文「内侍司（ないしのかみ）」とありますが、内侍司はないしのつかさと読み役所名、ないしのかみは尚侍と書き、内侍司の長官を指します。原文が混乱しておりますが、ここでは文脈より「ないしのかみ」であろうと思われるため、「内侍司の長官」と訳出しました。

sen.j: その美貌と当世風で華やかな人柄から朱雀帝の寵愛を一身に受ける一方、源氏との逢瀬も密かに続けていた。
sen.e: While receiving the favor of Emperor Suzaku due to her beauty and her modern, fashionable personality, she continued to meet in secret with Genji.

sen.j: 朱雀帝は自身が源氏の魅力に及ばぬことを認め、朧月夜を責めなかった。
sen.e: Emperor Suzaku admitted that Genji's magnetism outdid his own and did not blame Oborozukiyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: が、彼女との関係が発覚したことが右大臣と弘徽殿大后の怒りを買い、源氏須磨流しの一因となった。
sen.e: However, it made the Udaijin and Empress Kokiden furious when the relationship between herself and Genji was revealed, and it was one of the reasons that resulted in Genji being exiled to Suma.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.cmt: 「大后」はEmpress Dowager としました。

sen.j: 源氏の不在中に父太政大臣（元右大臣）が死去。
sen.e: While Genji was away, her father, the Grand minister of state (the former Udaijin), passed away.
While Genji was away, Oborozukiyo's father, the Grand minister of the state (the former Udaijin), passed away.

sen.j: 朱雀帝退位の後、源氏の全盛時代には朱雀院に従った。
sen.e: After Emperor Suzaku abdicated the throne and during the pinnacle of Genji's power, she followed Suzakuin.

sen.j: 朱雀院出家後に再び源氏と関係を持つ。
sen.e: After Suzakuin became a Buddhist monk, she had intimate relations with Genji again.

sen.e: After Suzakuin became a Buddhist monk, she had intimate relations with Genji once again.

sen.j: が、最後は源氏にも告げずに院の後を追い出家、物語から退場する。
sen.e: However, she ended up becoming a Buddhist nun following Suzakuin without telling Genji about it, and left the story.
